title: Very high ping with windows 10
body: I recently build a new computer with windows 10 and the first few days had no issues with ping. Today, however, my ping has been consistently 300+. When I ping the server from cmd, it shows normal ping and I also have normal ping in the loading screen. I have searched for various remedies and have disabled many of the windows 10 privacy settings, but I haven't seen any decrease in ping.

replies.body: I know how to fix it, I wrote a discussion on it, its on my profile{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

With a new rig, it's important to make sure your OS is updated to the most recent version, as well as any [outdated drivers](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting#wq1).  You may also be having network issues here failing to maintain a steady connection specifically to the game server, which would result lag spikes or input delays.  I recommend using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help out with this, and fix up your connection.  Let me know if you have any questions!

I'm having a similar issue to, except I'm on Windows 8.1. Whenever I start a game, my ping is around 200. I have to manually disconnect and reconnect the game to get the ping to a lower level (around 60). According to the Hextech Repair Tool, I should have a ping of around 38-40, which was my regular ping before these large spikes. 
http://imgur.com/a/QrIxE
I have no idea what caused this. I was playing one minute and the ping was fine and the next it suddenly spikes. My guess is that it had something to do with the maintenance they recently had.
